dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORY Isaacson, 23, unconventionally good-looking, breezil confident but entirely approachable (almost dishevelled, even) sits shitting on a toilet.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, definitely. EXT. BRENDAN’S APARTMENT —- BALCONY BRENDAN Ehrlick, 23, conventionally GREAT looking, sharpl dressed, is out on his balcony in West Hollywood, Califor looking out the setting sun.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I need you to come to LA.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I’1l pay.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: What’s going on, is everything-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: (deep breath) Cory. I’m gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: ...what?

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: You're gay.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: What? How do you know I’m gay, you don’t know I’m gay-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: I know you’re gay.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: How long have you known I’m gay-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Since like...I met you, what, freshman year-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN CORY
dialogues.text: I- But I didn’t know- So that’s like five- almost six years-—

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Why didn’t I tell you your sexual orientation?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I- I just- I thought-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Dude, you’re pretty gay-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: (feminine whine of protest) What about me is gaaaaaay-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: I- you- are you fucking kidding right now-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: This is a big deal!

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: --.sort of-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be so calm about this? This is my whole life here-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: What’re you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Does anyone else know?

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: ...Yes?...Everybody?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: What!? HOW!?

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: You’re not subtle- all you talk about is clothes, and cooking, and you spend more time on your hair than any guy I’ve ever met, gay or straight-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: But that’s not-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: And you always comment on what women are wearing-—

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Lots of men do that-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Yeah but you always do it like, you know, like “I'd like to be wearing that-” Brendan gasps.

dialogues.speaker: CORY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You live in West Hollywood, isn’t that like, the gay place-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: No but- I didn’t- I didn’t move here because I was gay, I wasn’t gay yet-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: You were always gay-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just moved here because the people looked nice!

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Like, yeah, like nice to fuck? Like the men, the gay men looked nice to fuck-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: NO! CORY god...DAMN IT!

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: I’m just glad it’s finally out, really. How did your parents-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: It’s not.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: It’s not out. I’m not out. Cory leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Your parents don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I haven’t told anyone. That’s why I want you to come. The new season of my show starts this Sunday and I want to get it out before that. My parents are in town and I’1l just get it all done, clean sweep, but I need you to be here for...you know, emotional damage control. Cory thinks. A guy in a stall near him moans.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Now. Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Dude, I can’t- I’m still figuring out my move-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been moving for two years Cory. I bought you a ticket. Someone in the stall next to him flushes. BRENDAN (CONT’D) Did someone just flush a toilet?

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m sorry, I’m taking a shit in the bathroom at the IHOP on Florence street.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: +..-I love that IHOP. Cory notices the toilet paper is out. He sighs. Cory look around deep in thought. He bites his lip, and then:

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: I guess I’1l see you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Yes! I love you Cory! Everything's all in your email alr- Cory hangs up. He slowly pushes open the stall door, and peeks out. The coast is clear. We watch as he makes an awkward hopping run with his pants around his ankles to t stall next to his, and pushes open the door. There’s a man on the toilet. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: I’m not gay. My friend is gay. There’s a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: CORY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gimme all your toilet paper.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM TO
dialogues.text: A Boeing 757 taking off.

dialogues.speaker: HER
dialogues.text: INT. HEATHER’S APARTMENT - NIGHT HEATHER Frost, 23, covered in tattoos, sexy as hell; she’ girl who knows what to wear and how to wear it, leaning towards punk-goth...stripper. She’s arm candy for some ri tattoo artist, or rockstar at a douchebag party. Currently, she’s being SCREAMED AT by GABBI Shaw, 23, petite and lean, very pretty but doing he best to look androgynously masculine. Gabbi wears a tankt under a jacket, loose fitting jeans; the quintessential b lesbian, but with a delicate brightness to her that makes vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: How could you do this to me? I don’t understand! Explain to me, explain to me how you could fucking do this, are you this fucking broken? Are you just a, just a fucking sociopath- I don’t understand, I need you to explain it to me. I’m listening,...Explain it to me. There’s a beat.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Gabbi-

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I think you should leave.

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: You think I should leave? You think I should leave, really?

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: You know that we’re not exclusive, I don’t feel like I owe you any kind of-

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, what.

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: We're not exclusive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +. no?

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: Two years- two fucking years of my life-

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I told you I didn’t- I wasn’t ready for a relationship-

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: Then you can move out, I just think-

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: You WHORE, I HATE YOU, I can’t- I can’t even-

dialogues.speaker: HEATHER
dialogues.text: I really think you should go, you're out of control-

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: You're just gonna- no! You're not kicking me out because I’m mad at you, I- I have a right- I have a xright-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabbi stalks along alone.

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: (muttering) I have a right- I have a right, I have a- I- Gabbi squats into a ball on the sidewalk and lets out a long, angry scream. She slumps down onto her butt, and begins sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIM
dialogues.text: We can’t hear anything over INXS’s “Listen Like Thieves,” it’s clear why after a moment: Cory is listening to it on iPod, completely zoned out.  He notices his bag, and steps forward, kneeing a little indian girl in the face.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: OH! Oh...jesus. Oh jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cory’s waiting for Brendan’s car, which pulls up; a cool convertible. Brendan pops open the door, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: No fuck that shit get out and hug me. Get out and hug me, there we go. Brendan and Cory hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're driving.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: So where’s the LA part of LA? Brendan laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CORY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s funny?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: There just...there are a couple different ones.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: We've been driving for like twenty minutes. We'd be out of Fort Lauderdale by now.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Yep. LA’s like a jigsaw puzzle that someone forgot to assemble, all the pieces are...spread out on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Wow, this sounds great. A passing car honks wildly, and a hot teen girl leans out

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Her friends scream from inside, and Brendan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Is that...does that happen often?

dialogues.speaker: SNAP TO
dialogues.text: At an intersection, a bunch of black girls cat-calling at Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: SNAP TO
dialogues.text: Driving on sunset, a limo full of debutantes shouting and yelling at Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: SNAP TO
dialogues.text: At a stoplight, a group of teen girls has approached and Brendan is signing autographs. Cory is just plain annoyed this point.

dialogues.speaker: SNAP TO
dialogues.text: INT. BRENDAN’S APARTMENT Brendan’s apartment is too-clean, decorated with posters throughout Brendan’s career, from age 12 onwards, startin with some atrocious thing called HARDHEART HIGHSCHOOL. Cory looks from HH/HS to SUMMER BOYS (age 14) to I’M MY D (featuring a time machine), and the flops down onto a cou while Brendan goes into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: So. (beat) You're gay.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Maybe. I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Oh hold on whoa, what? I flew out to LA, you're gay. No will she or won't she bullshit, you’re gay-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Well I don’t know for sure-  10.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: How? What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I’ve never- you know, I’ve never been with a guy-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s how being gay works, dude.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: CORY BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I mean do you like guys? It’s not that simple-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: That’s- well, I mean it kind of is, actually, exactly that simple, do you want to have sex with men? In the kitchen, Brendan falters.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I mean-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Do you wanna have sex with any more girls?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I don’t- I mean I wouldn’t mind, I don’t mind.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Did you used to like having sex with Erin?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: You're not...dude, you’re a TV star-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, TV, C list-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: I’m not on a list, okay, C is a passing grade. You’re rich, you drive a convertible in LA-  11.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Right, so?

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: So why gay now? Brendan falters again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan and Cory are strolling along. Brendan wears sunglasses and a hoodie, the classic disguise of the LA actor.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Griffin, his name is “Griffin.”

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: He works on set for the show, and-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Griffin...is a fairy. Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I catch him-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: -Mythologically confusing, but-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: -looking at me, and, you know, they talk, everyone in the crew talks, and those bitches all already think I’m gay-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: -I wonder why.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: It’s not gay to call people bitches.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: .--No comment.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: But there was talk Griffin was gonna ask me out, and I thought it was funny, and then...he kissed me. On the prop truck.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Is that a gay thing?  12.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: No it’s a truck where we keep the props! Jesus Cory-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: And then what?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know , I’ve been- I mean he’s been trying to call me, but I’ve been ignoring him for a week now-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: But you liked kissing him?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I- It was like I’d been waiting for a guy to kiss me my whole life and I didn’t know until it was dangling in front of my face.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: And now I just, I think about it, but I’m- I don’t know-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Scared?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: No. I’m not scared. I just want to do this the right way.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: You're not scared.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: No. Cory looks at Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Can I see your phone.  13.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, yeah. Brendan hands Cory his phone, and Cory starts pressing buttons. BRENDAN (CONT’D) And it’s the worst possible time, too; I finally have this moment where I’m being taken seriously as an adult actor, and I don’t want....You know, there’s this shadow, I think-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: What's “The Abbey?”

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: What? It’s a gay bar, it’s around the corner-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Griffin says he’s there right now.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: (infuriated) What, you texted him-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Around this corner? Cory starts to head in the direction of the Abbey.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Wait, Cory, c’mon- you’re such a-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: What? We go there, we find Griffin, you ask him out.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I can’t just walk into a- I can’t just- I had a plan, I have a way I want this to go, first my parents, then the public-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: He's right there. Why walk thirty emotional miles or whatever when you can walk one? Or something, some better metaphor-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Cory-  14.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: This is what I am, man, I’m now or never. You brought this on yourself. Now do we balls out, back to college, NO FEAR, or do we go home and eat yogurt, man, you have a shitload of yogurt in your fridge and if that’s what you wanna do. (beat) Are you a man, or yogurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights flash, music blasts, and it’s a great time; fuck i YOU want to be at this club. It’s mostly gay men, but the are some lesbians mixed in. Cory and Brendan are at the crowded bar, Brendan trying t keep, his face low. Cory’s taking a shot, while Brendan ignores his.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: This is spectacular!

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen this many gay dudes in one place!

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, welcome to Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: It’s so boring back home, man, I never do anything anymore. Like nothing like you wouldn't believe it I don’t do anything, man. (laughs, chipper) I packed all my bags in my place to move like two years ago and I haven’t even touched them, I’ve been living out of bags man! Brendan looks at Cory; what a completely bizarre, kind of creepily sad thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: ...-Are you okay? Cory seems to snap out of something.  15.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Do you see Griffin? Brendan looks around tentatively picking up his shot glas seeing GRIFFIN, early 20s, handsome but not gorgeous, kin hipstery, intellectual looking. He’s on the other side of the bar, goofing off and laughi with his friends.

dialogues.speaker: CORY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that him? Brendan turns, hiding his face.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: He’s not as dreamy as I thought he'd be. I went into this afraid I'd see this guy, and boom, me gay too. Brendan peeks at Griffin, who abruptly is BACKLIT AND STR A POSE. A sexy female voice whispers “Griffin.”

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Well I think he’s fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: (tugging Brendan towards Griffin) Then let’s just-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: No, I- not yet, okay, I’m building up to it.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: You got it dude. We’ve got all night. Cory grabs one of the little kebab swords from behind the bar, and uses it to snag an olive from the garnish tray. On the other side of the club, Gabbi is sitting over ina booth, staying out of people’s way. She’s hunched over a beer, almost done. A CUTE PIXIE GIRL comes up.  16.

dialogues.speaker: PIXIE GIRL
dialogues.text: Hey. You seem down, is there anything I can- Gabbi just raises a hand: “STOP.”

dialogues.speaker: PIXIE GIRL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, well, I’m here all night. The Pixie wanders off. Gabbi sighs, drains the rest of th beer, and gets up, starting to push through the crowd bac towards the bar. A timer pops up on-screen, counting down from :45 seconds

dialogues.text: Can we go?

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: We've been here two minutes-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I know-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Less than two minutes-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I know, I just-

dialogues.text: We’re not done here, man, this place is our mecca, we're gonna be here TIL THEY SHUT IT DOWN-

dialogues.text: This isn’t why I wanted you to come-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Why then? Emotional support? You can get emotional support on the phone, you can get emotional support in an email. You called me here to help blow your stuff up. Boom.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: .-.-You might be right.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: So go forth! CONFRONT! Osmose the...juices- or- not that, but you get the-  17. Brendan stares longingly at Griffin, then shakes his head violently.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I can’t- I can’t yet- I’m going to the bathroom, and then we’re leaving.

dialogues.speaker: YOGURT NIGHT. THE YOGURT MAN.
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Two more tequila shots, por favor!

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: How can they gender divide the bathrooms when everyone wants to have sex with everyone, that’s anarchy. It’s anarchy! 10...9...8...7...

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Brendan. It’s cool. It’1ll be fine. 6.2256. Ae ee Bene

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: It‘’ll be fine. Brendan pushes away the newly delivered shot, and heads o towards the bathroom. Cory turns to face Gabbi, who’s sli into the bar next to him.

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: Hey, is he gonna drink this? There's a beat, both of them staring at each other blankl

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: Your date, seemed like he didn't want it-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: You're vulturing a stranger's drink?

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: It's been that kind of night.  18.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Cory laughs, and glances over at the bathroom door; Brend gone for now.

dialogues.speaker: CORY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What kind of night is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom is extremely crowded, and TRICKED OUT; it’s red light except a disco-ball that spins on the ceiling. Abba’s “Dancing Queen” plays on an endless loop. Brendan looks miserable.

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: (laughing) -I’'m a chef, actually.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: No, I’m- y’know, I’m a cook-

dialogues.text: Is that different?

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: Chefs get the hats, cooks get the grease burns. Hoo-ah.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: You're hardcore.

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: What do you do? The tequila shots Cory ordered arrive. Gabbi looks at the

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: You're probably gonna wanna take one of those if you’re gonna hear about my boring ass job.

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: Now you’re buying me drinks?  19.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: No, I’m handing you a drink, and then you’re handing me money. Capitalism.

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
dialogues.text: You're charming.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: My time ain’t cheap. Gabbi toasts him, and then takes the shot. Cory laughs an takes his.

dialogues.text: Brendan finally gets a stall, shoving his way in, but som ASSHOLE shoves his way in alongside him.

dialogues.text: HEY! Dude, what are you-

dialogues.text: Wh-

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: NO I’M SOMEONE DIFFERENT GET OUT

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: -that’s basically it.

dialogues.text: So you go somewhere-

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Yeah, me in my car, driving all around Central Florida-

dialogues.speaker: GABBI CORY
dialogues.text: You ride into town- Like a cowboy-  20.

dialogues.speaker: GABBI
